Detailed Description

Objects and functions dealing with the 52 cards.

Author:
Tadeus Prastowo <eus@member.fsf.org>

Typedef Documentation

typedef int(* card_sorter)(const card *before, const card *new, const card *after)

Determines where a card should be inserted in a collection of cards. Several predefined card sorters are: sort_card_after() and sort_card_by_rank().

Parameters:
[in] before the card before this candidate insertion place (this is NULL for the place before the first element).
[in] new the card to be inserted.
[in] afer the card after this candidate insertion place (this is NULL for the place after the last element).
Returns:
zero if the new card should not be inserted in this candidate place or non-zero if the card should be inserted in this candidate place.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum card_rank

The rank of a card. It is guaranteed that the place of the existing enum values will never change.

enum card_suit

The suit of a card. It is guaranteed that the place of the existing enum values will never change.

enum card_suit_rank

The 52 cards. It is guaranteed that the place of the existing enum values will never change.

enum itr_action

What the iterator should do.

Enumerator:
CONTINUE  Continue iterating.
BREAK  Stop iterating.
REMOVE_AND_CONTINUE  Remove the card under the iterator from the hand and continue iterating with the next card. The pos and len values supplied to the callback function in the following iteration will stay constant as in this current iteration reflecting the removal.
REMOVE_AND_BREAK  Remove the card under the iterator from the hand and stop iterating.

Returns the string representation of a card.

Parameters:

unsigned long count_cards_in_hand ( const card_hand *  h  ) 

Counts the number of cards currently in hand.

Parameters:
[in] h the hand whose number of cards is to be determined.
Returns:
the number of cards in hand.

const card* create_card ( enum card_suit_rank  csr  ) 

Creates a card having the desired suit and rank. The returned card has to be freed with destroy_card().

Parameters:
[in] csr the desired suit and rank.
Returns:
an immutable card or NULL if the card cannot be created due to invalid csr or insufficient memory.

card_hand* create_hand ( unsigned char  max,
card_sorter  sorter 
)

Creates an empty hand to hold cards. The returned card hand has to be freed with destroy_hand().

Parameters:
[in] max the maximum number of cards that the hand can contain.
[in] sorter the callback function to determine the place where a card should be inserted in a hand. If this is NULL, sort_card_after() is used as the default.
Returns:
an empty card hand or NULL if an empty card hand cannot be created.

card_deck* create_shuffled_deck ( void   ) 

Creates a deck of shuffled cards. The returned card deck has to be freed with destroy_deck().

Returns:
NULL if the deck cannot be created or a deck of shuffled cards.

const card* deal_from_deck ( card_deck *  d  ) 

Deals a card from the deck. You do not need to free the dealt card because all dealt cards will be freed upon destructing the deck with destroy_deck(). This also means that you cannot maintain a reference to a dealt card after destroy_deck() is called on the deck from which the card is dealt.

Parameters:
[in] d the deck from which the next card is to be dealt.
Returns:
the dealt card or NULL if the deck is empty.

void destroy_card ( const card **  c_ptr  ) 

Reclaims the memory space that was allocated for the card as well as setting the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. The card to be freed must be a card obtained from strtocard() or create_card(). Passing a pointer pointing to NULL is safe but not a NULL pointer.

Parameters:
[in] c_ptr the pointer pointing to a card to be freed.

void destroy_deck ( card_deck **  d_ptr  ) 

Reclaims the memory space that was allocated for the card deck as well as setting the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is safe but not a NULL pointer. WARNING: all pointers to a card that has ever been dealt from the deck will be invalid.

Parameters:
[in] d_ptr the pointer pointing to the card deck to be freed.

void destroy_hand ( card_hand **  h_ptr  ) 

Reclaims the memory space that was allocated for the card hand as well as setting the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is safe but not a NULL pointer. This destructor does not free the cards that have ever been inserted. So, if you have ever inserted a card not dealt from the deck, you have to remember to free the card. All cards dealt from a deck will be freed when the deck is destroyed.

Parameters:
[in] h_ptr the pointer pointing to the card hand to be freed.

unsigned long get_max_of_hand ( const card_hand *  h  ) 

Returns the number maximum number of cards that the hand can contain.

Parameters:
[in] h the hand whose maximum number of cards is to be determined.
Returns:

enum card_rank get_max_rank_of_hand ( const card_hand *  h  ) 

Determines the maximum rank in the hand. If the hand is empty, the result is INVALID_RANK. You should always check first whether or not the hand is empty.

Parameters:
[in] h the card hand to be checked.
Returns:
the maximum rank in the hand.

void insert_into_hand ( card_hand *  h,
const card *  c 
)

Inserts a card into a card hand. The card will not be inserted into the hand if the hand is full already. You should check whether or not you can still insert a card into a hand first. The inserted card must not be freed before its reference is removed from the hand because further operation on the hand may segfault.

Parameters:
[out] h the hand into which the card will be inserted.
[in] c the card to be inserted into the hand.

int is_card_in_deck ( enum card_suit_rank  c,
const card_deck *  d 
)

Checks whether or not a particular card has not been dealt from the deck.

Parameters:
[in] c the card to be looked for in the deck.
[in] d the card deck to be checked.
Returns:
0 if the card has been dealt or non-zero if the card has been dealt.

void iterate_hand ( card_hand *  h,
card_iterator  itr_fn 
)

Iterates a hand invoking the callback function for each iterated card in the hand.

Parameters:
[in] h the hand to be iterated.
[in] itr_fn the callback function that will be invoked in each iteration.

Returns:

void remove_from_hand ( card_hand *  h,
enum card_suit_rank  c 
)

Removes all cards having the same suit and rank from a card hand.

Parameters:
[in] h the hand from which a card is to be removed.
[in] c the card to be removed.

void reset_hand ( card_hand *  h  ) 

Resets hand empties a hand without freeing the cards removed from the hand. This should not burden you unless you have ever inserted a card that you have ever created directly using create_card() or strtocard(). In that case, you have to free the card yourself using destroy_card().

Parameters:
[in] h the hand to reset.

int sort_card_after ( const card *  before,
const card *  new,
const card *  after 
)

Inserts a new card after the last inserted card (to be used with create_hand()).

int sort_card_by_rank ( const card *  before,
const card *  new,
const card *  after 
)

Inserts a new card after a card with a lower rank but before a card with a higher or equal rank (to be used with create_hand()).

void strip_card_from_deck ( enum card_suit_rank  c,
card_deck *  d 
)

Removes the specified card from the deck. This is different from deal_from_deck() in a way that this removes an arbitrary card from the deck preventing the card to be dealt while deal_from_deck() always removes the top most card from the deck.

Parameters:
[in] c the card to be removed.
[in] d the deck from which the card is to be removed.

const card* strtocard ( const char *  str  ) 

Creates a card whose suit and rank are specified in the string. The returned card has to be freed with destroy_card().

Parameters:
[in] str the string representation of a suit and rank.
Returns:
an immutable card if the string representation is valid or NULL if it is invalid or the card cannot be created.

enum card_rank strtorank ( const char *  str  ) 

Returns the rank specified in the string.

Parameters:
[in] str the string representation of a rank.
Returns:
the rank or INVALID_RANK if the string is invalid.

Variable Documentation

enum itr_action(* card_iterator)(unsigned long len, unsigned long pos, const card *c)

The callback function used to iterate the cards in a hand. Since iterating a data structure with more than one iterators at once where not all iterators is reader clearly is an equivalent of doing multi-threading, it is not allowed by designing the iterator to be very strict. It is a total mess when you iterate a data structure with Iterator1 and use Iterator2 within Iterator1 to remove the iterated element under Iterator1's nose.

Parameters:
[in] len the total number of cards in this hand.
[in] pos the 0-based position of the current card in the hand.
[in] c the current card under the iterator's view.
Returns:
the action that the iterator should do next.
